intro: Heptapleurum luzoniense, commonly known as the Luzon holly, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky slopes.
